content: IMHO it's odd that the description states the number of items can be up to 10 million but the biggest test is mere 1 thousand items

why do you not say Ik=Ik+1 -1, i think thats its more intuitive this way. And why do you want the full sequence as output? The first and the last value should be enough, since every number is just the one before it +1.

In your example the output "0 2" could be enough.

And can you explain your "Brute Force Solution"? Iam pretty sure i bruteforced this problem without problems

you're right, the"brute force" i was thinking about is O(n^2), which seems to be ok on the last test case in javascript, and maybe any other scripting language . I added that but i dont really now how many time is allowed (it seems to be 2s in IDE but could be less ?)
It could have been relevant if test case input had a higher size limit, but actually it is not

concerning output, yes we can optimize it, but is it the purpose :) ?
Number of items N is < 1500 , but constraint could be in first position
I think you have 100 ms for your programm to respond and 1000 ms compile time, at least in contests but iam not 100% sure about that
